verses.text: Now therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the statutes and unto the judgments, which I teach you, for to do \add them\add*, that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which the \sc Lord\sc* God of your fathers giveth you.
Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall you diminish \add ought\add* from it, that \add ye\add* may keep the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc* your God which I command you.
Your eyes have seen what the \sc Lord\sc* did because of Baal-peor: for all the men that followed Baal-peor, the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath destroyed them from among you.
But ye that did cleave unto the \sc Lord\sc* your God \add are\add* alive every one of you \add this\add* day.
Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the \sc Lord\sc* my God commanded me, that \add ye\add* should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it.

Keep therefore and do \add them;\add* for this \add is\add* your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation \add is\add* a wise and understanding people.
For what nation \add is there so\add* great, who hath God \add so\add* nigh unto them, as the \sc Lord\sc* our God \add is\add* in all \add things that\add* we call upon him \add for?\add*
And what nation \add is there so\add* great, that hath statutes and judgments \add so\add* righteous as all this law, which I set before you \add this\add* day?

Only take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life: but teach them thy sons, and thy sons’ sons;

\add specially\add* the day that thou stoodest before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God in Horeb, when the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and \add that\add* they may teach their children.
And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burnt with fire unto the midst of heaven, \add with\add* darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only \add ye heard\add* a voice.
And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, \add even\add* ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
And the \sc Lord\sc* commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it.
Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no \add manner of\add* similitude on the day \add that\add* the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire:
lest ye corrupt \add yourselves\add*, and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
the likeness of any beast that \add is\add* on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the air,
the likeness of any \add thing\add* that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that \add is\add* in the waters beneath the earth:

and lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, \add even\add* all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve them, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole heaven.
But the \sc Lord\sc* hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, \add even\add* out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of inheritance, as \add ye are\add* this day.

Furthermore the \sc Lord\sc* was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that \add I\add* should not go in unto \add that\add* good land, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee \add for\add* an inheritance:
but I \add must\add* die in this land, I \add must\add* not go over Jordan: but ye \add shall\add* go over, and possess that good land.

Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the \sc Lord\sc* your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, \add or\add* the likeness of any \add thing\add*, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath forbidden thee.
For the \sc Lord\sc* thy God \add is\add* a consuming fire, \add even\add* a jealous God.

When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children, and ye shall have remained long in the land, and shall corrupt \add yourselves\add*, and make a graven image, \add or\add* the likeness of any \add thing\add*, and shall do evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, to provoke him to anger:

I call heaven and earth to witness against you \add this\add* day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto you go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong \add your\add* days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
And the \sc Lord\sc* shall scatter you among the nations, and ye shall be left few in number among the heathen, whither the \sc Lord\sc* shall lead you.
And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
But if from thence thou shalt seek the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, thou shalt find \add him\add*, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, \add even\add* in the latter days, if thou turn to the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;
(for the \sc Lord\sc* thy God \add is\add* a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and \add ask\add* from the one side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been \add any such thing\add* as this great thing \add is\add*, or hath been heard like it?
Did \add ever\add* people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?

Or hath God assayed to go \add and\add* take him a nation from the midst of \add another\add* nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the \sc Lord\sc* your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
Unto thee it was shewed, that thou mightest know that the \sc Lord\sc* he \add is\add* God; \add there is\add* none else besides him.
Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.
And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty power out of Egypt;
to drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou \add art\add*, to bring thee in, to give thee their land \add for\add* an inheritance, as \add it is\add* this day.
Know therefore \add this\add* day, and consider \add it\add* in thine heart, that the \sc Lord\sc* he \add is\add* God in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: \add there is\add* none else.

Thou shalt keep therefore his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee \add this\add* day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong \add thy\add* days upon the earth, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee, for ever.
Then Moses severed three cities on \add this\add* side Jordan toward the sunrising;
that the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbour unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
\add namely\add*, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, of the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, of the Manassites.
And this \add is\add* the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:
these \add are\add* the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came forth out of Egypt,

on \add this\add* side Jordan, in the valley over against Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come forth out of Egypt:
and they possessed his land, and the land of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, which \add were\add* on \add this\add* side Jordan \add toward\add* the sunrising;
from Aroer, which \add is\add* by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto mount Sion, which \add is\add* Hermon,
and all the plain on \add this\add* side Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
